Key Arguments: The legislation could lead to an Orwellian state where free speech and open debate are suppressed.
The bill grants excessive power to the government, ACMA, and digital platforms to silence dissenting views.
The exemption of government communications from censorship is hypocritical and unfair.
The bill's definitions of misinformation, disinformation, and harm are vague and subjective.
The legislation could damage democracy by imposing harm on the integrity of democratic processes.
The proposed censorship powers lack accountability and could lead to excessive censorship.
Notable Quotes: This Bill would give power to the government, ACMA and digital platforms to silence anything that opposes the prevailing ideologies / political agenda.
No government is the ultimate 'Truth authority'.
This type of forceful government control of information would be expected in a totalitarian society.
